title: @riot: please stop screwing around with items that werent designed for adc
body:
why are you changing {{item:3071}} and {{item:3156}} in their favour?

maw is already a cost effective item for any ad champ who wants to mitigate magic burst. and even if a lot of adc arent getting it, its still a good item for them aswell as anyone else. the lifesteal and attack speed on the new passive are directly targeted at adc. why? the increasing ad bonus was good for everyone. the new passive isnt.

and cleaver. this just boggles my mind. the item was designed as a CORE item for heavy fighters. why in the 9 hells would you change it in a way, to make it more accessable to adc? it completely defeats the purpose of what the item was made for. its not SUPPOSED to be effective for them but for champions who try to fight them. and they want the extra health.

i dont agree with the scimitar change either.

what youre doing with adc items like phantom dancers is one thing, but please dont take this ever to live.

replies.body:
Wasn't the whole point {{item:3071}} was reworked months ago was to make it better for it's intended class?

The changes to BC are one of changes that shouldn't go live.

BC is currently a must buy for every melee AD champion. It's ludicrously overpowered and has absolutely no competing items whatsoever. That said, Riot's proposed changes aren't going to change either of those things, so feel free to carry on.
I won't say it's a must buy for every AD melee champs.That's a little bit of an exaggeration.But for those who it is intended for (tank AD fighters),it certainly is a must.

No. Cleaver is so damn good it can work on assassins, and that's a serious problem.

That being said, -100 hp and +15 AD is NOT the way to go.  The price however, is way too low. It's about 3.2k gold worth of stats not counting the 30% armor mitigation (which can have a total value into the thousands if stacked on multiple members of a team) and the pretty much permanent 20 movespeed that bumps up to 60 on kills and assists.

And Last Whisper is 60% gold efficient for the 35% armor pen. 30% armor SHRED on an already cost effective item is obscene.

Actually, not all AD assassins use {{item:3071}}. They can all use this item effectively, but it is not a core item for all of them.

For {{champion:121}} specifically, I think that this is a core item, because unlike most AD assassins, he doesn't benefit a lot from {{item:3142}} (Kha'Zix already has a lot of natural sticking power and the attack speed and crit are wasted, he is by far the least AA-reliant AD assassin), also, his burst is lower and more conditional when compared to other AD assassins. He needs to stay on combat for a longer time, thus, the HP from The Black Cleaver benefits him a lot. Also, he really likes when he is able to max CDR.

However, for other AD assassins like {{champion:107}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:91}} this is not a core item. It is still an optional item for them, but they don't really need the extra HP from The Black Cleaver, also, they really benefit from {{item:3142}}. They have the freedom to focus on squishier builds when compared to Kha'Zix, due to their overall burst being higher.

I didn't mentioned {{champion:114}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:92}} because it is extremely debatable whether they are assassins or fighters. That said, with the exception of Yasuo, they can all use The Black Cleaver effectively, too. However, this item is only core for Fiora, and optional for the others.

You make some solid points, I just wanted to throw out that A) Lee Sin in his current state is an "everything", so it doesn't matter so much what you build on him, and B) Master Yi is pretty un-debatably most effective with an assassin build, unless you're really crappy at picking your fights.

but in the past they have taken care not to make cdr available to adc, since theyre already strong enough for their auto attacks. giving them strong spells and crits on autos would be unfair. i guess thats over now.

So take some of the other stats away. AP gets AP, mana regen, cdr, and grevious wounds on their big cdr item, or a small amount of mr, less ap, and way more regen. AD get health, AD, cdr, and a ridiculous amount of armor reduction. 

Call me crazy, but I think I'd take 30% mr reduction over mana regen/grevious wounds.

large price increase of 500g, 100 less health, 10 more ad.
15 ad actually but still that is **ed up tho

15 more AD, plus LW no longer affects base armor while Cleaver does. Cleaver is now stronger than a LW on tanks with high base armors, like Rammus and Braum who have 104 and 103 respectively at 18. That's 50% reduction that you can't reduce with a LW anymore, you have to use Youmuu's, Cleaver, or an Armor REDUCING ability, like J4 and Wu's Q. 

When they have 300 armor, which is a bonus of about 200. LW will ignore about 90 armor. Cleaver would reduce their armor by about 75. If they only have 200 armor, a boost of 100, then LW ignores 47 where as Cleaver ignores 50. 

Cleaver is the damage go-to option for bruisers since it does best against high base armor tanks where as LW helps them kill the hiiiiigh bonus armor tanks like Malphite and Sion. (Sion only has 70 base.) To make it not so powerful, they boosted the cost, lowered the health, but increased the AD to make sure people know it's not a perfectly well rounded item to pick up at any time, but an item you get for damage.
The price increase is because of the overall gold rework. That isn't really relevant to the discussion.

BotRK was a replacement for Madred's Bloodrazor.

No difference from now that BotRK is built on 3-4 Adcs (Vayne, Rat, Kali, Kog) and easily 10 junglers/toplaners/assassins (Yi, Xin, Trynda, Irelia, Jax, WW, Nocturne, Aatrox, Olaf, Shyvana AD/Hybrid Eve, ~~Even more Cancer~~ AD Fizz, Zed and Yasuo).

Unlike other champions like Yi Jax Irelia in which it is either their first or second item so they rely on it for midgame, and they usually don't build more than 2 damage items so many games it's their only source of damage, so 2% less damage on BORK is going to hurt them much more than it will hurt an ADC who also has a Bloodthirster, IE, and LW on the side.

I dunno. I sort of like it for Nasus since they added in CDR at the loss of some AP. Considering the 5% from masteries is 'almost' gone, it's nice to be able to get a Sheen, FH, and Visage and have maxed CDR for the Q farm. It's actually quite nice.

2. The lifesteal for sustain

The passive %HP is just the icing on the cake, this nerf doesn't do as much as you would think. Not to mention her %HP true damage is getting buffed so her damage will rely on the passive even less.

Rito loves their freakin' ADC's

Not really. ADCs have arguably been pretty bad compared to what they once were in Season 2. Metas are defined by who shits on ADCs more and they are always the target of oppression. In Season 4  when it was Kha and Lee all over the place with Zed/Talon the ADC could hardly play the game since he would die before it mattered and was really only taken to shove towers down after a won fight. Even in this last season when it was mainly control mages Viktor would laser an ADC for over half their health and they were out of the fight or he would simply kill them with ult or Q. Same with Annie. Spring Split was arguably just as bad for tanks when it was literally stack a bunch of CC monster tanks on your team and win since your goal was to make their team go afk through stun locks while still doing a large amount of damage. 

I am not denying the fact that these ADC changes are a bit extreme and will probably get nerfed but it has been a very long time since ADC were the penultimate role on the rift where Juggermaw comps were a viable strategy.

Let me start by saying that any and all AD champions will benefit from the new maw passive. AD champions have to be balanced around the fact that their auto attacks **usually** scale 1:1 with their total AD. so with the new maw passive those non marksman, for example {{champion:11}}, {{champion:5}}, {{champion:266}}, {{champion:59}}, {{champion:238}}, {{champion:91}}, etc. will benefit equally. You still get the ad, you still get the mr, you still get the shield, now you get lifesteal and attack speed too. Can't say I see the problem, since this is just a buff to all ad champions. Similar case for scimitar too, except that I actually see maw being built sometimes.

Even as an adc main though, I must say I don't like the cleaver change and would like to know the real context behind that decision. I don't think they are trying to make it an adc item (we have last whisper upgrades for that) but the changes do seem oddly in that direction.

I guess it's hard to make new items for the game or something.
 I mean if they have ideas for new adcs overlords itemization fine just make a new item, but having the nerve to remove CORE item's from other classes when said class is already suffering in variety while ADCS have already one of the broadest set of items baffles me or any top laner, we are already going to be destroyed by ranged champions after they buffed their early game(WHY?!!?), and now even if miraculously some of us manage to not get rekt the first 5 mins of the game we can't even build ourselves properly.

Besides the price increase, are the BC changes really a big deal?

Using it as a sole or one-of-2 damage item for a bruiser build, you'll still get plenty of Health from your other itemization, while doing a bit more damage than before. Whereas people who get BC without other bulk items don't get as much bulk out of it.

It seems like it was changed around the assumption that you'll be building additional Health on top of it, but that's just my 2 cents.
